00025 //These define the macros for the 32 road pieces.  The column contains the macro ID and
00026 //the second contains the gridno offset from the anchor position (where the user clicks in the world to
00027 //place the road).  The actual index of the array refers to the offset from ROADPIECE001.

00375 
00376 INT16 gsRoadMacroStartIndex[ NUM_ROAD_MACROS ];
00377 
00378 //A simple optimization function that calculates the first index in the large database for 
00379 //the particular macro ID.
00380 void InitializeRoadMacros()
00381 {
00382       INT16 i, end;
00383       INT16 sMacro = 0;
00384       end = sizeof( gRoadMacros ) / 4;
00385       for( i = 0; i < end; i++ )
00386       {
00387             if( i >= sizeof( gRoadMacros ) / sizeof( MACROSTRUCT ) )
00388             {
00389                   i = i;
00390             }
00391             if( gRoadMacros[ i ].sMacroID == sMacro )
00392             {
00393                   gsRoadMacroStartIndex[ sMacro ] = i;
00394                   sMacro++;
00395             }
00396       }
00397 //    i = ROADPIECES001;
00398 }
00399 
00400 //Road macros vary in size from 3 gridnos to 18 gridnos.  Using the anchor gridno based off of the original
00401 //road system, this function will place the new macro (consisting of multiple road pieces in multiple
00402 //gridnos).
00403 void PlaceRoadMacroAtGridNo( INT32 iMapIndex, INT32 iMacroID )
00404 {
00405       INT32 i;
00406       UINT16 usTileIndex;
00407       i = gsRoadMacroStartIndex[ iMacroID ];
00408       while( gRoadMacros[ i ].sMacroID == iMacroID )
00409       {
00410             AddToUndoList( iMapIndex + gRoadMacros[ i ].sOffset );
00411             RemoveAllObjectsOfTypeRange( i, ROADPIECES, ROADPIECES );
00412             GetTileIndexFromTypeSubIndex( ROADPIECES, (UINT16)(i+1) , &usTileIndex );
00413             AddObjectToHead( iMapIndex + gRoadMacros[ i ].sOffset, usTileIndex );
00414             i++;
00415       }
00416 }
00417 
00418 //The old road system used multi-tiled roads as a single image.  The new road system has taken these large
00419 //pieces and chopped them up into single tiled images (to mitigate lighting problems).  Some of the larger 
00420 //road pieces turned into 18 smaller pieces.  So this function will go analyse the world, and replaces any 
00421 //locations containing the original road tile information, delete it, and replace it by inserting it's 
00422 //equivalent macro.
00423 void ReplaceObsoleteRoads()
00424 {
00425       INT32 i;
00426       INT32 iMacro;
00427       LEVELNODE *pObject;
00428       BOOLEAN fRoadExistsAtGridNo;
00429       for( i = 0; i < WORLD_MAX; i++ )
00430       {
00431             pObject = gpWorldLevelData[ i ].pObjectHead;
00432             fRoadExistsAtGridNo = FALSE;
00433             while( pObject )
00434             {
00435                   if( pObject->usIndex >= FIRSTROAD1 && pObject->usIndex <= FIRSTROAD32 )
00436                   {
00437                         fRoadExistsAtGridNo = TRUE;
00438                         iMacro = pObject->usIndex - FIRSTROAD1;
00439                         PlaceRoadMacroAtGridNo( i, iMacro );
00440                   }
00441                   pObject = pObject->pNext;
00442             }
00443             if( fRoadExistsAtGridNo )
00444             {
00445                   RemoveAllObjectsOfTypeRange( i, FIRSTROAD, FIRSTROAD );
00446             }
00447       }
00448 }
00449 
00450 #endif
